info.name: Restaurant API Collection
info.description:
# Restaurant API

This API(identifiable as Restaurant API in the meantime) will serve as an online collection of restaurants, for existing or newly created online and onsite restaurants, providing them another platform for sales.

It is a mobile food vendor to customer services. Food vendors will place food items they have on their profile, with cost price(including delivery), customers will scan through, find what they want and place orders. Payments will be made to the platform, vendors can withdraw from their account at anytime.

Endpoints for this API is exposes in this documentation, with instructions and examples of requests and expected responses.

**Authentication**: This API uses JWT authentication, and some of its endpoint requires a valid JWT to be supplied in the request header.

**Configuration**: This collection requires several predefined environment variable, which are listed below. You will need to add them to your own environment when testing with Postman

`url`: The root url. The default value should be 127.0.0.1:5000  
`access_token`: JWT used for login. It will be set automatically by some of the request test scripts.  
`refresh_token`: Used for refreshing a JWT. It will be set automatically by some of the request test scripts.

request.description:
#### Initializes a Vendor's registration. Sends Vendor's confirmation ID and Registration Link in email. Use confirmation ID received in email to build Register Vendor request.

`Note:`

\* Duplicate **Email** not allowed  
\* Invalid email will return a 500

response.name: Email Register
Invalid email /internal server error
Internal Server Error

request.description:
#### This Resource is to request a resend of the confirmation email in case the initial one expires, or is unused for some other reasons . It receives the email in the path parameter. ID sent to email also to be used for building Register Vendor request URL.

`Note:`

\* Email must already exist(must have already registered email)  
\* Will only process request for un-validated email accounts  
\* Email must be passed in URL

response.name: Resend Email
Account for such email not found

exec: // set access token as environement variable
// set refresh token as environement variable

request.description:
#### This Resource completes the registration of a Vendor. Uses the confirmation ID sent in the email as path parameter.

`Note:`

\* Duplicate **Restaurant name** not allowed  
\* Confirmation ID expires in 30 minutes  
\* Confirmation ID can only be used once

response.name: Not found or wrong confirmation ID
Already existing Restaurant name
Confirmation ID/Vendor already validated

exec: // set access token as environement variable
// set refresh token as environement variable

request.description:
#### Logs a Vendor in, by issuing an access and refresh token. Tokens to be used in the Authorization header for protected Resources.

`Notes:`

\*   Account must be created and validated before login
\*   Access token expires after 15 minutes after which refresh token should be requested

response.name: Unvalidated or unregistered account

exec: // set access token as environement variable

request.description:
#### This Resource refreshes a Vendor's token, when expired. It issues a non-fresh token and requires a refresh token as Authorization header.

`Note:`

\*   Requires Authorization header, set to `Bearer {refresh_token}`
\*   Must be logged in before making this request
\*   Must send a valid JWT token

response.name: Invalid token/not logged-in
Token authorization header required

exec: // set access token as environement variable

request.description:
#### This request is made when critical actions or resources(resources that requires only fresh tokens) are requested with a non-fresh tokens. It issues a fresh access token and requires a refresh token.

`Note:`

\* Password of logged in vendor must be correct.  
\* Authorization header must be set to `Bearer {refresh_token}`
#### This Resource takes the Vendor's ID in the URL as path parameter and returns the Vendor's details.

#### This Resource deletes a Vendor's account. It takes Vendor ID in the URL as path parameter.

`Note:`

\*   Authorization header must be set to `Bearer {access_token}`
\*   Token must be fresh
\*   Operation privilege limited to owner of the account

response.name: operation  privilege not granted

request.description: #### This Resource returns all Vendor accounts, and their full details

response.name: Get All Vendors
response.body:

item.name: Get All of a Vendor's Confirmation

request.description: #### This Resource returns all confirmation details of a Vendor. This is meant for testing only

response.name: Get All of a Vendor's Confirmation

request.description: #### Returns the most recent confirmation details of a Vendor. This resource is for testing only.

## Updates less critical vendor account details for logged in Vendor and return all details for the account including the just updated details.

`Note:`
- Set Authorization header to `Bearer {access_token}`
- One or all of the fields can be blank

### This Resource is for requesting a password reset, when password is forgotten. A token is sent to Vendor's email. Token is to be used in URL as path parameter for the Reset Password request or resource.

response.name: Forgot Password

request.description:
### This Resource is to reset password when forgotten. The token sent to email from the Forgot Password request is used. Token used is immediately revoked after a successful password reset.

`Note:`

\*   Token expires after 5 minutes

response.name: Reset Password

request.description:
### This Resource changes a Vendor's password when the password is not forgotten. It requests the present password, ensures its correct and saves a new the new entered.

`Note:`

\* Authorization header must be set to `Bearer {access_token}`  
\* Token must be fresh

### Revokes the Vendor's access token. This request and the Refresh Logout must both pass to successfully logout a Vendor.

`Note:`

\*   Must be logged in
\*   Authorization header must be set to `Bearer {access_token}`

response.name: Access Logout

request.description:
### Revokes the Vendor's refresh token. This request and the Access Logout must both pass to successfully logout a Vendor.

`Note:`

\*   Must be logged in
\*   Authorization header must be set to `Bearer {refresh_token}`

response.name: Refresh Logout

request.description:
## Avatar Upload or Vendor's Logo Upload. 

`Note:`

\*   Content-Type should be set to multipart/form-data
\*   File should be sent with `"image"` key
\*   Authorization header should be set to `Bearer {access_token}`
\*   The only allowed extensions include  
    `'.jpg', '.jpe', '.jpeg', '.png', '.gif', '.svg', '.bmp'`

### Deletes a Vendor's Logo/Avatar. It takes the Vendor ID as path parameter. Privilege is limited only to owner of the account.

`Note:`

\*   Authorization header must be set to `Bearer {access_token}`
\*   Privilege for this operation will only be for owner of the account

response.name: No privilege granted
